content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Two measure melody in treble clef, four-four time. Half notes A4, B4, A4, and G-sharp 4.
Two measure melody in treble clef, four-four time. Half notes A4, B4, A4, and G4.
Two measure melody in treble clef, four-four time. Half notes A4, B-flat 4, A4, and G-sharp 4.
Two measure melody in treble clef, four-four time. Half notes A4, B-flat 4, A4, and G4.

content.answer: Two measure melody in treble clef, four-four time. Half notes A4, B-flat 4, A4, and G4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
